data: Refer to Pediatric Hypoglycemia Management Algorithm for Patients with Diabetes
If patient has a POC Glucose Whole Blood reading less than 4 mmol/L, refer to Pediatric Hypoglycemia Management Algorithm for Patients with Diabetes for all treatments
Monitor POC Glucose Whole Blood as per algorithm after every step of treatment has been administered
Notify provider if blood glucose remains below 4 mmol/L following initial treatment
Re-check 2 hours post hypoglycemia treatment , to ensure it remains greater than 4 mmol/L
If patient is alert and can be treated with oral rapid acting carbohydrate
Administer sucrose 6 g, PO, as directed, PRN: hypoglycemia
Administer 6 g of fast acting carbohydrate, PO, as directed, PRN: hypoglyemia
Administer 12 g of fast acting carbohydrate, PO, as directed,  PRN: hypoglycemia
Administer 16 g of fast acting carbohyrate, PO, as directed. PRN: hypoglycemia
If patient is unconscious and/or seizing with IV access
order rate: 2 mL/kg, IV, q10min, PRN: hypoglycemia, drug form:bag
6 g, PO, q15min, PRN hypoglycemia, drug form: tab
12 g, PO, q15min, PRN hypoglycemia, drug form: tab
16 g, PO, q15min, PRN hypoglycemia, drug form: tab
If patient is alert but cannot be treated with oral glucose (e.g. NPO or vomiting) without IV access
0.02 mg, subcutaneous, q15min, PRN: hypoglycemia, drug form: kit
0.03 mg, subcutaneous, q15min, PRN:hypoglycemia, drug form: kit
0.04 mg, subcutaneous, q15min, PRN:hypoglycemia, drug form: kit
0.05 mg, subcutaneous, q15min, PRN:hypoglycemia, drug form: kit
0.06 mg, subcutaneous, q15min, PRN:hypoglycemia, drug form: kit
0.07 mg, subcutaneous, q15min, PRN:hypoglycemia, drug form: kit
0.08 mg, subcutaneous, q15min, PRN:hypoglycemia, drug form: kit
0.09 mg, subcutaneous, q15min, PRN:hypoglycemia, drug form: kit
0.1 mg, subcutaneous, q15min, PRN:hypoglycemia, drug form: kit
0.11 mg, subcutaneous, q15min, PRN:hypoglycemia, drug form: kit
0.12 mg, subcutaneous, q15min, PRN:hypoglycemia, drug form: kit
0.13 mg, subcutaneous, q15min, PRN:hypoglycemia, drug form: kit
0.14 mg, subcutaneous, q15min, PRN:hypoglycemia, drug form: kit
0.15 mg, subcutaneous, q15min, PRN:hypoglycemia, drug form: kit
If patient is unconscious and/or seizing without IV access
0.03 mg/kg, IM, q15min, PRN: hypoglycemia, drug form:kit
0.5 mg, IM, q15min, PRN: hypoglycemia, drug form:kit
1 mg, IM, q15min, PRN: hypoglycemia, drug form:kit
